name: Barbary Sheep
description: Its appearance and lifestyle resemble goats more, though biochemical studies suggest a closer relation to sheep. Males have impressive horns over 70 cm long and a long mane on the lower neck and chin. Females are smaller with much weaker horns.
image_alt: Barbary Sheep, photo: Prague Zoo Archive
proportions: Body length 1.3–1.7 m; tail length 15–25 cm; shoulder height 75–110 cm; weight 40–145 kg
attractions: Barbary sheep enjoy sunning themselves on seemingly inaccessible rocky ledges in their enclosure, blending perfectly with the rock due to their brown coloration.
breeding: We have kept them since 1995 and regularly breed them.
